Reviews.Title: “Beautiful little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Frankie731
Reviews.Content: I loved staying here -- it was a little getaway weekend for just me, and I took a small room on the courtyard side, away from traffic noise but without any view. This was OK with me, although I did have to close the curtains as you could see across the courtyard into someone's apartment (and vice versa)! Some people might prefer the street side for this reason. The room was clean and charming, as was the whole hotel. At first I thought the 13 euro charge for breakfast was a lot, but not after I had far less food for more money at a nearby cafe! So, actually, if you like a nice sit-down breakfast with a lot of croissants, etc. the breakfast here is generous. It is not a buffet but rather is served to you. The location was perfect for me, because I could walk to the Place des Vosges, the Picasso Museum, the Pompidou Center, Notre Dame, etc. and because I love the Marais. I will definitely be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Great location!”
Reviews.Author: 000CST000
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel! Great service and location. Would recommend to others and will stay there again on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Hotel in Marais”
Reviews.Author: Venice1503
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 24 - 27 March. Upon arrival at the hotel, I felt transported back in time. The hotel reception is welcoming and is decorated with pretty furniture & wallpapers. There is even a 1792 piano in the reception. My room #21 is a front facing twin room and has a charming small balcony. The room is beautiful - with wooden ceiling beans, chandelier and floral-print curtains. It has air-conditioning too. The bathroom is spacious and clean. The hotel location is prefect. There are many cafes and restaurants around the hotel. BHV, a local departmental store, is just a 10mins walk away. We like the small individual shops in Marais too. I would recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Beautiful Family Hotel That Made Our Trip To Paris”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca W
Reviews.Content: This is a small yet beautiful hotel in an excellent location in the centre of paris (less than 10 minute walk to the Notre Dame). All staff were amazingly friendly and helped with any queries we may have had, the room was beautiful and very very clean. Would stay here again without hesitation, this beautiful base made our trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in great location with professional staff”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotterGuy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a combination business/pleasure visit to Paris. After finishing the business portion of our trip, we made a point to change hotels from the normal business hotel booked by our company, booking ourselves into the Caron de Beaumarchais for a long weekend centered around the dynamic Marais district. We couldn't have been more pleased with the hotel itself, the staff, and the great location. Before arriving, we were a bit concerned there might be noise, given the location just off Rue de Rivoli and knowing that Rue Vieille-du-Temple can be very busy with pedestrians at certain times of day. But we needn't have worried. The hotel was a quiet oasis, out of the bustle. Our courtside room was small, but quite normal for Paris and not a hardship. The room was laid out with care and thoughtfulness. We found each one of the staff to be quite professional, friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable about the area. The breakfast was enormous by French standards, even by some American standards. We were treated to an assortment of breads, yogurt, eggs, fruit, preserves, juice, and coffee. The Caron de Beaumarchais is conveniently located for enjoying the Marais and the rest of Paris. There are lots of shops and cafes on the same street and throughout the Marais, more shops around the corner on Rue de Rivoli, Place des Vosges 5 to 10 minutes away by foot, and the St. Paul metro stop just a couple of blocks away. Ile St-Louis, Ile de la Cite (with Notre Dame and Sainte-Chapelle), and the Latin Quarter are also not far and can be easily reached by walking. The Picasso Museum, the Carnavalet and even the Pompidou Centre are nearby. Some of the reviews here have mentioned transportation to CDG airport for 20 euros. I think a few comments about that might be helpful. The hotel can arrange a taxi to the airport for around 60 euros, which will be a direct trip. The hotel is also able to reserve slots in a shared shuttle van (a "Navette" in French). If you book the shuttle, the price is 20 euros for two people, but please be aware that the shuttle might go to several hotels for pickups before proceeding on to the airport. My wife and I booked the shuttle and at one point we were quite worried about making our flight. Although we knew it would be a shared ride and we had allowed plenty of time, one of the pickups was late and we had to wait, plus the driver received a phone call for a last minute unscheduled pickup which delayed us further. In the end, the driver got us to the airport on time, but had to maneuver his way heroically through morning rush hour, dodging trash trucks and morning deliveries. I wouldn't say you need to avoid the shuttle, just make sure you allow plenty of time. Overall, we heartily recommend the Caron de Beaumarchais and we'll definitely visit there again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the Marais”
Reviews.Author: GoldenBear_Husker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent five nights at the Caron during our summer holiday. We very much enjoyed our time there and would return. First off, by American standards, the rooms are tiny. However, by Parisian standards, they are normal sized...considering the price. We had a lovely little room facing the courtyard meaning it was very quiet. Because of abnormally warm temperatures, the air conditioning in the room was true luxury. So many 3-star hotels in the area do not have A/C. As spoiled Americans, we like our rooms pretty cold and this was accomplished at the Caron. The staff at the hotel were simply wonderful. They were very helpful and attentive to all requests. They provided excellent restaurant suggestions, were very adept and helping us navigate the Metro system, and even assisted us with using their complimentary wireless internet when my laptop was not cooperating. Our room was always immaculately cleaned and the maids left plenty of towels for us as well. American travelers, another warning: many of the bathrooms have tub/showers without shower curtains. We were worried about soaking the bathroom by using the shower without a curtain and were told, "no worries." Took a little getting used to, but end of the day, it was, indeed, all good. While the staff at the Caron is wonderful and the rooms lovely, the best part of the hotel is its location. The Caron is located near several Metro stops and is within easy walking distance of so many sites. We loved be so close to everything. We also loved the "vibes" of the neighborhood and walking the streets of the Marais. Also enjoyed the farmer's market which set up on Saturdays and Wednesday's just across the square from the Hotel. Are the better hotels in Paris? No doubt, yes. However, if you want to stay in the Marais and have a staff treat you as a special guess, there are few better places than the Hotel Caron de Beaumarchais.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: photographerx
Reviews.Content: I met my girlfriend in Paris and we began our journey here. It was a lovely little hotel, very quaint, very authentic and very french. Fantastically located, close to le metro as well as just a hop and skip to some of the oldest parts or Paris. Hands down one of the best value hotels in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint - but small - great location!”
Reviews.Author: N0rthernVisit0r
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our first experience in Paris together. We arrived and were greeted by a lovely woman who was exceptionally kind and helpful. When shown to our room we found that it was very typical Paris - small.... very small. My partner and I barely had room to walk around the bed, and found that the bathroom, which was equally as small - had some water spillage issues when it came to showering. There was a man working there, who we found at times to be a little on the rude side - perhaps he had a lot on the go, but his working partner was lovely. The hotel was a very unique experience though, the location was superb! We really loved its centrality and it was lovely when the woman was working , as she was very helpful in finding things and giving us help. I would recommend - if you can afford it - try to upgrade your room, as the ones on the lower floors of course, are much smaller - dark and exposed to noise from the street. Overall - it was a unique first experience, and we really enjoyed ourselves in Paris. Just be aware of the likelihood of classic rooms being quite tiny :)

Reviews.Title: “Romantic little Gem in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: EleganceCeline
Reviews.Content: We loved the Caron de Beaumarchais. After walking the romantic streets of Paris, this is the perfect adress to come home to after a long day. It's in the middle of Paris in "the place to go to neighbourhood" - Marais, which is practically in the centre of everything. Metro is just 250 meters away which will accommodate you to wherever you want to go within minutes. The rooms are very tastefully decorated with antiques which just ooze Paris, and give a very homey vibe. The rooms are quite small, but for Parisian standards it's good. For a comfortable stay, you can order a good breakfast in the rooms without an extra charge. Overall it's all very good value for your money. Been to Paris quite often, and can't think of a place more romantic than this. Definite go-to!

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AZ1596
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is elegant and charming, the rooms are a bit small but very comfortable. The staff is friendly and ready to help in case of need. The position is perfect, in the middle of the Marais, and a few minutes’ walk from various metro stations. Breakfast at the hotel is nice, but if you prefer to go outside there are many places around, as "Le Pain quotidien", not far away. Definitely a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel in a fine location...”
Reviews.Author: GRSimpson
Reviews.Content: Just of Rivoli in Rue Veille du Temple, this is a great place to stay. Sweetly and classically decorated with a wonderful staff and really close to so much of what Paris offers - and in the extremely cool Marais district. Rooms are small, but that's OK and the bed is the best (and last, before heading home to NZ) we've experienced in 9 months of travel in Europe and USA - and quite a few hotels. In one of the coldest weeks in Paris for a long time it was lovely to come back to the hotel after a long day of sight-seeing. Very good advice from the team: use the buses to get around, instead of the metro. We did to get up to Montmartre and saw a lot more of the city. Fast internet, too... Highly recommended...

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay Paris Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Scott W
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights 7th and 8th Feb 2011. Have visited Paris perhaps 15 times over the last 25 years and in more recent years, purely out of habit, have chosen the large homogenous business class hotels. Trouble with these hotels of course is that once you take a few steps through the door you leave behind the entire raison d'etre for your trip: the unique culture and character of this beautiful City. You may as well have walked in from the streets of Liverpool or Newcastle and it is only upon realising that the French speak better English than they do in Liverpool and Newcastle that you realise you are in fact in a foreign city. So for the complete Paris experience we set out to find a quality small family run hotel rich in character, low in cost and conveniently situated. The Caron was perfect on all counts. Very friendly and helpful staff, small but nicely decorated rooms (antique furniture, fabrics on the walls, lush curtains etc) and brilliantly situated for many of the main attractions (Seine, Bastille, Notre Dame, galleries of the Place des Vosges, antiques of the Saint Paul "village" etc all a few minutes walk) as well as being surrounded by shops and restaurants of every description. Check-in was the best I have ever experienced. Whereas in the larger hotels you queue for check-in, then give your name, wait till they trace your booking which always seems to take 300 or 400 computer key strokes, fill out a registration card (even though you have already given your details when you booked online), confirm how long you are staying, initial your registration card in various places to acknowledge you accept the ludicrous rates and additional charges, hand over your passport, give a credit card imprint and then faint when you hear how much extra you pay for wi-fi, at the Caron we walked in, introduced ourselves to a young woman sitting behind a small antique desk who smiled, welcomed us to the hotel and handed us our room key together with a small piece of paper on which she had written the (free of charge) wi-fi code. A small taste of how simple life used to be.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dannyboy10025
Reviews.Content: Right in the Marias is a charming affordable hotel.......Rooms are small but antique filled Staff and on premises owner make it all the better.......breakfast served downstairs by the loveliest of servers All in All worth it

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: G-de-Paris
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect example of "you get what you pay for." It's not expensive, nor is it super cheap...so you get an *excellent* location, comfy beds, but subpar linens, microscopic rooms (even the superior rooms are a tight fit for two people with lots of luggage), polite service, but not many amenities (no kitchen/roomservice, spotty wifi, cheap soap). But if you're like me, and you just use your hotel as a place to sleep because you're out all day/night, you'll find this hotel quite comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Barbara J
Reviews.Content: We spent two weeks here in December 2011. The staff was always helpful. They gave us directions on many occasions, made réservations for us for dinners, and made shuttle arrangements for us to thé airport. Samira, who brought us breakfast every morning, was a delight, even on Christmas morning when I'm sure she would have préfèrred to be home. The hôtel is in a fabulous location, within true walking distance of Centre George Pompidou, Notre Dame and thé Picasso Museum (although it is closed for rénovation). Although the hôtel very close to two métro stops, it is on bus line 69, which goes to the Louvre, Musee D',Orsee, Eiffle Tower, Musee Rodin, Rue Cler and Hôtel de ville. I can't say enough good things about this hôtel. But it is only as good as the people who work there and they are all tops.

Reviews.Title: “French style boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: calby
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely positioned in le merais and close to metro. The reception staff are very helpful and booked us a lovely restaurant for Christmas dinner. Also ask for shuttle transfer to the airport for only $20 for 2 people! Extremely cheap and reliable. The room is small but the norm for French hotels. Free in-room wifi included. The bed only came with a sheet and an old blanket for winter temperature so we had to rug up to sleep. The bathroom has the basic fit out but the lack of a shower curtain meant the bathroom was quite wet after the shower. Overall, nice stay but room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Esmond_Fancy
Reviews.Content: having lived in Paris for three years in this area (the Marais) and having returned many times for business and pleasure I can wholeheartedly recommed this hotel in terms of location, quality and price. The reception staff are first class and their English is perfect. The usual Paris caveats apply: rooms are not US sizes, and the frontside rooms can be a little noisy, but they are thoughtfully decorated and it makes a great change from staying in some corporate chain styled in 'International Bland. Recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Memorable Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: piddyman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights and had a great stay. The staff was pleasant, the location perfect and the style/ambiance of the rooms was great. Granted, the rooms are not particularly big by any standard but they are cozy and comfortable. We got a room facing the street which has a good view. I think if would have gotten a room with no view or a courtyard view the rooms would have felt too small. We got the breakfast package and had a beautiful spread delivered to our room - incredible pastries, soft boiled eggs, fruit and a pot of stellar, strong coffee. It doesn't sound particularly amazing but whenever we talk about our favorite breakfasts of all time, this one always comes up. Its a great way to start a daily adventure in Paris. Next time we are in Paris we plan to stay here. Can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in the best location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: GothenburgProfessor
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel many times and have always been very pleased with everything. The location is perfect, right in the middle of Marais, close to Rue Rivoli (but not so close that the traffic is disturbing). The staff is great, always helpful, giving directions, making restaurant reservations, etc. Rooms are small but very nicely decorated with old furniture, a small pot with flowers and bathrobes. Internet is excellent and free. Be sure to have breakfast in the hotel. It’s delicious with yoghurt, a kiwi, three types of jam, baguette, croissant, pain au chocolate and a big pot of really nice coffee. This is without doubt our favorite hotel in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: TulsaTravellgirl
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Caron de Beaumarchais. The staff was extremely helpful, giving us great advice on restaurants and arranging a van to take both of us to the airport for 20 Euros. The neighborhood the hotel is in is quintessential Paris. It is an easy walk to the Hotel Deville metro station. The little elevator might be hard to handle if you are claustrophobic and the rooms are small, but wasn't a problem for us. Would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and charming hotel in nice location”
Reviews.Author: Chrisa T
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris to celebrate my daughter and son in law's wedding at the American Church. Several of our party stayed at Hotel Caron de Beaumarchais. What a lovely and charming place to stay. Friendly and helpful staff made our short stay very pleasant. Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice place to stay that takes you back in time.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in the Marais”
Reviews.Author: Tasty-Fish-UK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated just off the Rue de Rivoli in the Marais district. It is a perfect spot for exploring the local area and very close to several Metro stations. There are loads of restaurants and bars within easy reach. The hotel is wonderfully quirky - the decor transports you back in time to the 18th century and is certainly rather different from the usual bland, modern hotels. Room was small (expected in Paris) but was clean and extremely quiet - no traffic or street noise at all. Reception was very friendly and helpful with some good ideas for evening meals. We didn't try the breakfast - at 13 euros a bit pricey - but there is plenty of choice in the nearby cafes. It's not the cheapest but you're paying for something a bit different in a brilliant location. Would heartily recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Tres romantique and pretty boutique hotel right near the Seine and Hotel de Ville”
Reviews.Author: engagedinberlin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Caron de Beaumarchais for two nights. Since it was our mini-moon after having just got married, expectations were high and they were amply met. The location is unbeatable; the Seine, Louvre, Pompidou, Ille de St Louis, Musee d'Orsay, Bastille etc are all an easily walkable distance and there is also the achingly pretty environs in which the hotel is immediately situated, Le Marais. As others have said, the staff are fantastic. They speak very good English but also encourage your burgeoning French too if you have a go! They helped us with lots of things like fighting for a taxi to take us to Gare du Nord (the staff member rolled up her sleeves and fought through Paris rush hour to flag one for us! - about approx €12 to Gare du Nord), reconfirming our restaurant booking and posting letters home. A big hit in our room was the breakfast in bed. €13 for a tray containing fresh pastries and french bread, hot chocolate, yoghurt, a soft boiled egg, homemade jams, cheese, fresh orange and a kiwi. All served with a copy of the Herald Tribune. Perfect. My partner and I enjoyed lounging around in the Hotel's bath robes and writing letters on the pretty stationery provided. The room was very charmingly decorated with period furniture and detail. To make for a balanced review, I will say that we were initially disappointed that the room was smaller than expected and the bed was two singles pushed together and that we didn't have a balcony but that quickly wore off because everything was so pleasant and the beds are very comfortable. The room had the gorgeous French windows that maintained that authentic Parisian experience, even without the balcony. We'd definitely return to the Hotel Caron de Beaumarchais, though I think we'd struggle because the phone was ringing nearly off the hook with bookings when we sat in reception! Do not hesitate to book this place. I would recommend it very highly indeed.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lisadenunzio
Reviews.Content: We spent three lovely nights here the beginning of November. The hotel staff was helpful from the 'get-go'. A request for early check in due to a flight rescheduling was accommodated increasing our short stay in Paris. Plus the balcony room that was requested became a reality providing a small area to enjoy a glass of rose and view the street activity below. We had breakfast delivered to the room. It was the same price as having breakfast in their charming downstairs dining area, but felt like a real luxury when the bountiful tray was delivered to our door. All staff exceptionally helpful with restaurant recommendations, boarding passes and general courtesy.

Reviews.Title: “Four Season's Level of Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Anne S
Reviews.Content: I have been to Paris many times. I have stayed in many 3-star hotels. All were perfectly fine. However, Caron de Beaumarchais was the best Paris hotel experience I have ever had... and this was due almost entirely to the amazing service of the hotel reception staff. All of them (and especially Genvieve and Etienne) went out of their ways to help us. Sometimes we just needed directions or for our restaurant reservation to be confirmed. Othertimes, when my phone was lifted by street kids, they allowed - at no additional charge to us - phone calls back to the States to get everything squared away. The hotel is quite charming, the decor is classic French... everything is elegant and tasteful. The room we stayed in was the tiniest room I have ever stayed in. And, truth be told, at the beginning of our trip, we were a little concerned about the room size (even though I am quite familiar with small Paris hotel rooms), but by the end of the stay, we were never more grateful to have chosen this hotel. The rooms are comfortable, well cared for, quiet, and the beds are comfortable. But the NUMBER ONE REASON to stay at this hotel is the service (especially if Genvieve and Ettiene are still working there). I get the feeling that the management/owners of this hotel feel that customer service is priority one, so probably all future staff will also have similar attitudes about helping their clients. Highly-recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Boutique Hotel in Marais”
Reviews.Author: Biryani
Reviews.Content: Lovely boutique hotel in Marais between Hotel de Ville & St Paul. All staff very helpful & fluent in English. Although the room was quite small (usual for Paris) it was very beautifully & tastefully decorated with antique furniture, exposed ceiling beams, fresh flowers in room & small balcony. Breakfast was plentiful although we didn't have it every day in the hotel as there were many boulangeries etc nearby. We were two women travelling together to celebrate our 60th birthdays & were very happy that we chose Hotel Caron de Beaumarchais for the real Parisian experience.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and great location! We will return!”
Reviews.Author: David S Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel at the edge of the Marais (between Hotel Ville and Saint Paul) and a few blocks from Rue de Rossier and the best falafel in the world! Close to Rue Rivoli yet quiet. Very tight room (smaller on courtyard side) but had everything we needed. Staff was very accommodating. Free internet but breakfast not included. Who needs breakfast with boulangeries and great coffee all over Paris! Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Old world elegance combined with modern convenience”
Reviews.Author: CapeTownDi
Reviews.Content: I agree with the many recent 'excellent' comments on this hotel. Great location, attractive decor, extremely helpful and informative staff (fully bilingual in French and English), good internet connection, clean and comfortable room, with nice little details such as fresh flowers, bonbons in a china box, antique writing desk, Roger & Gallet soap, two-speed hairdrier, pull-out washing line over the bath. The air conditioner worked well. The third floor room I was in was quiet - I didn't hear the other guests at night.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and staff!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaMelanie
Reviews.Content: The concierge and front desk staff went above and beyond for us. I was so impressed with this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: susanono
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little hotel in a great location in Paris. The rates are between 165 and 185 euros plus 10 euros for breakfast. The breakfast is substantial-soft boiled egg, yogurt, croissant, bread, pain au chocolat, cheese, fruit and jams and honey. The rooms are beautiful period pieces filled with wooden beams, antique furniture and modern TV and air conditioning. They are small but that's Europe. They also have big fluffy robes and a mini bar. Try to get a room with a little balcony. You really feel on vacation sitting at the cafe table on your balcony eating croissants for breakfast. The reception staff are wonderful. They all speak English (or whatever language you need) and they are extremely helpful. They can suggest a restaurant, call you a cab, or point you to the nearest post office. I heartily recommend this hotel and would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: 333penny
Reviews.Content: After searching widely for a hotel I was very pleased to have chosen the Hotel de Caron Beaumarchais. Yes it is tiny (as is the bathroom) but it was cozy, pretty and clean - all that I had wanted and expected from the description offered. Staff were very helpful and friendly and the location of the hotel was amazing. It was a short stroll to the Seine and a bus stop within 30 meters to take you to many of the tourist attractions. The Marais area is incredible with interesting shops,cafes and bars to name a few attractions. My daughter and I were in a 'courtyard' room as I thought it may have been noisy overlooking the street and if I returned I would definately pay more to have a front room, preferably on the floor with a small balcony. I don't think there would be much street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable, clean, amazing location and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: DB182
Reviews.Content: After extensive research which included scouring TripAdvisor, Budget Travel's "Secret Hotels of Paris", and the NY Times "100 Hotels Under $150", I ended up settling on the Caron de Beaumarchais for a labor day weekend trip with my mom. I mostly chose it based on the location (love the Marais--central, charming, and within walking distance of most sights), but ended up loving the charm and overall design of the hotel as well. I was just so pleased with our experience that I decided to write my first TA review! Positives: The staff was incredibly nice and helpful, the room was very clean and a good size for 2 people (by European standards--we stayed in a front side room, which, judging from the reviews, is definitely worth the extra money), beds comfortable, free wifi, AC, and a good sized, delicious breakfast (1 order is more than enough for 2 people). Also the location can't be beat, and the decor of the hotel was so French and charming, without being stuffy and old. Negatives: The walls were a bit thin so in the morning we definitely heard doors slamming etc as housekeeping went in to clean the rooms around us. It wasn't loud enough to wake us up but definitely loud once we were up. Also, some might be annoyed that you have to leave your room key at the desk every time you leave, but reception is 24 hours and it really wasn't an inconvenience for us. I will definitely stay here again on my next trip to Paris, both my mom and I are very picky and neither of us can recommend it highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but small”
Reviews.Author: brissotravellers
Reviews.Content: We found the location was excellent but the rooms are really really small. Bathrooms are tiny and can't fit two people. Still the place has a real sense of history, helpful front desk staff and one of the better locations in Paris. Felt safe walking around the neighbourhood . The price is quite reasonable and you feel like you are in Paris as opposed to staying in a standard Hilton.I wouldn't stay again even though I was happy as I think there is better value to be had.

Reviews.Title: “Great things come in small packages”
Reviews.Author: Warchild64
Reviews.Content: Despite seeing some of the comments - this Hotel is a real gem in the heart of Paris. It is ideally located for all sights, has friendly - informative staff, is well presented and offers everthing you could wish for from a city centre location. We visited recently for a 25th Wedding Anniv, between the 29th and the 1st August and it lived up to everything we could have hoped. Recommend to couples the world over.

Reviews.Title: “All CLASS”
Reviews.Author: Steve D
Reviews.Content: A week at this small but beautiful hotel, right in the heart of the fabullous Marais district, made our visit to Paris so memorable, The helpful and knowledgable Manager and the exquistely decorated rooms in 19th, century French style makes this place something special. Although not cheap, this hotel offers a truly Parisian experience that complements the many visits to all that is so great about this unique city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Sara45055
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after lots of research and with the help of trip advisor. It is located in the Marais district of Paris, a great central area. The area was quaint and full of lovely shops and small restaurants and eateries. Metro stops were close by - we arrived at Orly airport and caught the metro in with no problems. The Hotel was lovely - very ;French" as we think of it. The beadroom was a good size especially by European Standards. The bathroom was well equiped. The room was airconditoined and windows were double glazed so it was very quiet at night. We were especially impressed with the helpfulness of the staff. They were particularly great at suggesting places to eat - we wanted authetic French food not the tourist interpretation!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MarkB00
Reviews.Content: What a lovely Hotel. Our room was on the 5th floor, with a balcony. Small but had enough room for what we wanted. The location is perfect for anything you would want to do in Paris. Metro very close, and many sights within walking distance, which we preferred. The staff was wonderful, very helpful and attentive. We would definately stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely hotel with fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: embee10
Reviews.Content: My 11 year old daughter and I stayed here for 5 nights and were really delighted with our choice. I don't think we could have got a better location in the beautiful Marais district with everything we needed nearby including lots of shopping and great restaurants. The hotel and the rooms are small but lovely with loads of towels in the bathroom and a mini bar. Breakfast was enormous with one enough for both of us to share. We had a street facing room on the first floor and were surprised at how quiet it was. I will be recommending it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “amazing and unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: chana1525
Reviews.Content: i stayed with my daughter for three nights in a street facing room. hotel staff were friendly and informative. the room and bathroom very clean. the breakfast fantastic! the furnishings in good taste. fresh flowers, beds comfortable. unique design in the room and throughout the hotel. room size really ok!!! bathrooms a little worn but clean and well equipped!!! (fridge, robes, tissues) the location is excellent. i will be back and sending friends

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: aussie065
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so central; in the Marais, not far from Notre Dame, a 5 minute (if that) walk from a metro. Walking into the foyer is a step back in time. We had requested a room with a balcony; we enjoyed sitting out there for breakfast, which we picked up at one of the nearby patisseries, or sitting out there for a drink. Rooms with a balcony cost more, but we thought it good value for such a central, convenient place in Paris. While the room wasn't spacious, it was perfectly adequate. The staff were obliging, helping us book tours, tickets and advising best travel to train station. A great place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff & location”
Reviews.Author: lmeven
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 night, me and my daughter (12 years old). The staff was very polite, english speaker, helpful and nice. The hotel location is great. 3 minutes walking from two Metro stations: Hotel de ville & Saint paul (line 1). 5 minutes by foot to the Marais area and 15 minutes by foot to the Louvre and Place de la Concorde. The rooms are quite small, but beautifully decorated and comfortable. We enjoyed our staying very much.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in the world!”
Reviews.Author: Fernanda_Scagliusi
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice in this hotel, in January 2008 (with my husband) and in May 2011 (with my parents). The hotel is really cute and well decorated (the pictures in their website are very accurate). The room is small, yet really comfortable and quiet. The bed is excellent; the shower has good pressure and temperature. The location is amazing! The hotel's street is very beautiful and has a lot of bakeries, cafés, restaurants, bars and shops. It also has a very good fromagerie and a nice wine bar, which is also a book shop. The hotel is very close to the subway and several interesting places. But, above all, what makes this hotel special is its service. The owner and the staff are extremely kind, helpful and attentive, especially Philipp and Geneveuve. I hope I can travel to Paris many times and, each time, I hope to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our 1st trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: cindy-a-pierce
Reviews.Content: My mum and I just returned from an 8 day stay in Paris and we stayed at the charming little boutique Hotel Caron de Beaumarchais. I did a lot of research before hand, as I was traveling with my 65 year Mum, and wanted her to have the comforts that not all European hotels have. This hotel met all of our expectations : ~The location can't be beat (5min saunter to the Seine, right in the heart of Paris. 5min walk to metro) ~ All the staff we met were delightfully helpful and pleasant (Phillip & Genevieve were great). They were patient when we used our French, and welcoming when speaking in our native English. ~We had a front side room with a balcony, although just off of Rue de Rivoli it was surprisingly quiet. ~ Not only was our room decorated with a "Marie- Antoinette feeling" with grand drapes and exposed ceiling beams; our twin beds were comfortable, we had ample closet space for our clothes, and our room was impeccably clean. It was, as others have stated, the regular small Parisian size. ~The breakfast was large, my mother and I shared one between us, delivered to our room each morning...croissant, pain au chocolat, baguette, butter & jams, egg, coffee, fruit, yogurt, and cheese. The flavours were wonderful! ~As well as the cafes and restaurants around every corner, there is a delicious boulangerie 4 doors down and a Mon-op grocery store around the corner. Truly we were delighted with our find here, and will be booking here again for sure. Paris is such and enchanting city, and staying at Caron de Beaumarchais just added to the over-all wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and the best staff, it was a home for us!”
Reviews.Author: ttandjcc
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in the heart of Paris. The staff was bilingual and very, very helpful. Easy walk to the metro and lots of places to eat near by. Several grocery stores for a snack or wine were around the corner. Beautiful rooms, very comfortable beds and good space for Paris standards. We are planning our next trip before we even check out. Pay for a front room with a small terrace, it is tiny but totally worth it! Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and great location”
Reviews.Author: ellie1819
Reviews.Content: This hotel cannot be beat for location--near the Seine, the Marais and walkable to most everywhere. Service is excellent in both French and English. Rooms are charming--a bit small but not uncomfortable. One note: what they call the courtyard is really an inner atrium--no sunlight on the lower floors and not much air But very quiet and I used the A/C so didn't have a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: rosecanuck
Reviews.Content: My mother and I just returned from our trip to Paris, where we stayed at this hotel. It was great! The room we stayed in was small, but not uncomfortable and beautifully decorated. The decor is certainly not like anything we've seen before! Original antiques, gilded mirrors and portraits make you feel like you're in a different era (but the flat-screen TV and mini-fridge are pleasant reminders that this is 2011). Breakfast is 13 euros, which we thought was expensive at first. However, after visiting a couple other cafes for breakfast, where much less food was served- albeit at a lower price- we decided to eat at the hotel. The breakfast is HUGE! You're given fresh orange juice, tea or coffee, a kiwi, cheese, an egg, a croissant, a pain au chocolat, a baguette, yogurt and jams. The usual cafes just give you a croissant, baguette, coffee and juice for about 11 euros. The location is really good- next to many affordable stores and cafes. It's about a 2 minute walk from the islands and 1 minute to the subway (where you can easily take the #1 line to the Arc de Triomphe, Place de la Concorde and Louvre without doing an interchange). If you don't mind walking, in about 15 minutes you can be at the Louvre (*tip*: go to the mall beneath the Louvre and buy your ticket at the automatic machines and go in the Lion entrance. There's virtually no line-up there! If you're going on a free day, like we did, go straight to the Lion entrance and you'll be in within 5 minutes as opposed to 3 hours via the regular entrance). The staff are very accomodating and quickly booked a shuttle to get us to the airport for our departure. Phillipe in particular is perfectly bilingual- speaking French with a true parisean accent and English with a british accent. That said, all the staff speak both English and French and probably other languages too if you ask. We had a front side room and were not disturbed by noise outside, but if you're very sensetive, a court-side room might be better. All in all, we will definately stay at this hotel on our next trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Brandi01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a few days while we visited Paris. We couldn't have asked for a better location - we were in walking distance to the Seine, the Metro, Notre Dame, the Louvre, etc. The staff was very helpful and friendly (and spoke very good English since our French was limited). We had their breakfast each morning, which was not only convenient, but very good and reasonably priced. We found the value to be very good for this hotel considering its excellent location and charming atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location! Great Service! Enjoyed Our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: djack7
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a total of 6 nights at this perfectly located in the 4th. Our room was small as is typical of Parisian Hotels, but it did not impact our comfort at all. We wanted to be centrally located. The availability of cafes, shops and restaurants was excellent. Although our room was on the street side we slept comfortably without any concern of street sound. The staff were extremely helpful. A wonderful stay at a charming little Parisian Hotel. We utilized the Velib Bicycle System. What a pleasure. After a few disconcerting minutes getting used to traveling at the speed of bike in the city of lights we were comfortable. We travelled all over the city. If you plan on using the bike for less than 7 days still pony up the week few to avoid having the 150 euro deposit being held a number of times. Really make sure the bike is placed back and accounted for. Try to remember where you deposited the bike and its number in case of challenges. We used the Chip and Pin Passport Card from Travelex and it worked perfectly. In our opinion it is the best way to see Paris. In fact on our arrival day since we were still on Mountain Standard Time we were cruising the streets of Paris at 2am.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: mjg0510
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 11 years ago and couldn't wait to return. We stayed 5 nights in May 2011. We are so glad we did!!! The hotel is very clean and all the staff excellent and very helpful. Breakfast is wonderful, especially eaten on the balcony if you are lucky enough to get one. We were this visit. It is located in the Marais district which is the perfect location to start your visit in Paris. Steps to Notre Dame Cathedral, the Louvre and more. Great restaurants all around this area. Would stay no where else in Paris. Will stay again on our next trip to the City of Light!

Reviews.Title: “Still Awesome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: McAllister_Alli
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 4 years ago and enjoyed it even better this time. Great staff, great location and the new decor is just soooo cute! Rooms are a bit small but I think it's a good size for Paris anyway and the antics make you forget that the minute you enter your room. This is definitely "mon maison a Paris".

Reviews.Title: “Paris's Historically, Romantic Niche”
Reviews.Author: BonVoyageBelle
Reviews.Content: Hotel Caron de Beaumarchais is the most adorable hotel there ever was. From the minute you walk into their modest, cozy, and magnificently decorated lobby; you feel as though you have been transported to a time when Marie Antoinette still had her head. The fabric-covered walls, the old instruments, the quant little love seats, and the beautiful fire place; all make you feel as though you are sitting in a piece of Versailles. As for our room, it was wonderful! My mother and I stayed in a room in the front which had a window over looking the street. It was so lovely with the window box full of blooming pink flowers. The room had rustic wood beams on the ceiling, a crystal chandelier, and even a little writing desk with a small vase of flowers, and an ink jar, with a quill. The bathroom was pristine, white, and the towels all had the insignia from the hotel on them. I really enjoyed however, having breakfast in the hotel’s downstairs. The breakfast room was full of romantic portraits, crystal chandeliers, flickering sconces, and old books that would make the finest historian blush. The tables are covered with lacy linens, and the plates have the hotel’s insignia on them as well. I loved the service, and the breakfast was by far one of the best I had in France. The desk was ever so helpful, even the man who owned the hotel. I could not get over how he decorated such a beautiful place. When my mother, and I discussed how much we loved antiquing; he sent us down the street to an antique market. I would love to come back next time I am in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_april
Reviews.Content: I have been to Paris many times and prefers to stay near the Rue de Rivoli as that is close to everything and easy to get around by the metro. This hotel is very central, right between two metro stations (Hôtel de Ville and St. Paul). The hotel is very typical Parisian, with very small rooms, small elevator and steep stairs. But the rooms were very clean (we had two rooms). My mother and my aunt shared a room with twin beds. It was two beds, but they were so close together that you might as well call it a double bed. There was no room to move the bed further apart, but they didn't mind. I shared a double bed with my young daugher and even if the bed was quite small, it was comfortable. The hotel is decorated in the style of the 17th century and is very charming if you like that type of decor. Even though the hotel is a step away from the busy Rue de Rivoli, we heard no trafic or other noise from our room. The breakfast room was tiny, but the breakfast was very good and it was more than enough to eat. The staff is very friendly and even though I spoke French with them, I could hear them speaking very well English with other guests. They were very helpful and serviceminded. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of one of the nice parts of the Marais”
Reviews.Author: champagne007blogspot
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Caron de Beaumarchais is convenient for its location if you want to be in the Marais.I took a walk around and I wouldn't want to stay further north. It was safe which was one of the most important things being a solo traveller. I found that many of the restaurants were busy which is good but then I figured that I couldn't get a table for many that I would have liked to try. There was a small local store that sold fruit, fresh juice and other snacks about a 5 minute walk away and I found that handy. Also, there were quite a few bakeries / patisseries which was great. Compared to the other hotel I stayed in Paris which was located almost right outside a central metro station with many lines running through it (Chatelet), this one was a bit of a longer walk. But it was a pleasant one, only when it rained it wasn't so great. The size was comparable to the other hotel I stayed. I believe it's about standard by Parisian standards, so don't expect much space. Most of the staff are really helpful and friendly. i had some trouble with the wireless internet, but it was fixed that night though it wasn't easy initially to get help. I'm a light sleeper and I could hear people in other rooms early in the morning (6am) and also coming back at night. Other than that, I had no problems with noise. This was suppose to be a quiet room, but I suppose that these things can't be helped when you travel. I should probably drink more wine! Overall it was a pleasant enough stay and I'd consider coming back again, though I wouldn't mind trying another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Team_MV_Europe2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Caron de Beaumarchais for our first visit to Paris & it was so lovely...although the room was on the small side it was well designed to fit 2 suitcases in without having to move them about each time to move around. The staff were exceptional...upon settling the bill I asked what was the best means of transport to the airport, the concierge advised by taxi & then actually came outside with me to hail down a taxi then proceeded to help with my luggage & spoke to the driver to advise which terminal to go to. It was just the icing on the cake for me!! The only downfall was the fact there was no screen or curtain around the bath to stop the water from drenching the bathroom floor & basin etc

Reviews.Title: “Stay Stay Stay at Caron de Beaumarchais!!”
Reviews.Author: ctmarketgal
Reviews.Content: We did our homework online and kept coming back to this hotel and boy are we glad we did. Gracious, clean, helpful, incredible location, etc. Could not ask for more. When we checked in I tried to give Philippe our credit card and he brushed it aside and (in a "Ctanley with a C" way) said "all you need is a great attitude and a smile to check in". Fresh flowers, CNN on the tv for the little time we were in the room. We walked everywhere, from Amerinos and Berthillon ice cream, to galleries and cafes in the neighborhood (more than you can imagine), a three minute walk to River Seine, can cross right over to Ile St Louis and Il de la Cite. Great tip from hotel staff...at western tip of Il de la Cite there is a one hour river cruise for 12 euro (do not fall for the hundred euro dinner scam) and great cafes back in Marais for dinner. Right around the corner from an open market with various restaurants (but watch out, a few seem deliberately high priced for tourists, others not so much). Subway stops and bus stops close by. The Londerners and New Yorkers who crave a bit of home while there, three minutes away is a Le Pain Quotidien, but there is often a wait. Instead I suggest heading right out the door of the hotel and hit one of the patisseries on the street. Divine. All this within five or ten minutes of the hotel. Rooms are small but as everyone else writes, its Paris. I'm sure the rooms at the Marriott would be larger but also much more expensive and sterile. Would not stay anywhere else next time. It was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: Ceciliagirl
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a romantic 2 day break for my husband's birthday, and the hotel and location couldn't have been more perfect! We had a room on the 5th floor with a balcony, and yes, it was a little petit, but really lovely nonetheless. The bathroom was a good size wtih a good shower/bath. The service couldn't have been nicer, really great reception wtih perfect English, yet were patient to humour me with my terrible French, without laughing! The location is amazing - you are in the heart of the Marais, with great shops, art, bars, restaurants, coffee shops - all sorts. A lot of sights are walkable to and from the hotel, including Hotel de Ville, Notre Dame, Latin Quarter to name but a few. I would go back again and again....

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: Mezza76au
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here during October 2010 for 7 nights in a courtyard room. We loved it - much has already been said about the place but it's a great location and even though the rooms are small (where isnt in Paris?), we found the place very comforting and a great base for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again and Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: vlanyc
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful 5 days in a charming 3 star hotel in a perfect location. The service was extremely helpful - making bus reservations to airport as we left the first day of the strike. Very charming though the lobby looked like it could use a dusting. Didn't pay for breakfast as there was a bakery and coffee shop up the block.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: fabtash
Reviews.Content: This is a great central place to stay in Paris. Easy walk to everything, cafe and bars near by and great shopping street. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Excellent, Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Jacquelyn427
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days and it is in the perfect location. The beds were comfortable, the bathrooms were roomy and the decorations were authentic. The staff went above and beyond to assist us with finding a place to do laundry, book a tour, and book a train to Belgium. I would recommend this hotel to everyone and would absolutely come back to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice, great service!!”
Reviews.Author: SimonSingapore
Reviews.Content: If you like the Marais this is the place to stay! The location is simply unbeatable, the rooms are furnished tastefully and the service is outstanding. The receptions went out of the way to help us, particularly when there were no taxis in the city due to a snow storm and we had to reach the airport. It shows that it is a family-run property. If I were to look for negative points: there are no safes in the rooms (but you can deposit valuables at the reception) and the beds are on the narrow side for 2 big adults. Other than that I can recommend this property without any reservation. I'll return next time I'm in Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Third Stay”
Reviews.Author: Aimeezing1NYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed solo at the Caron de Beaumarchais for three nights while awaiting the arrival of my family in Paris. I've stayed at the hotel in the past - a week with my husband, and a night with my daughter and have been very pleased each time. It is a well maintained property - the staff is very helpful and fluent in English and the location and value couldn't be better. I have recommended the hotel to several friends and all have had fine stays as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: kit-uk
Reviews.Content: This was my second return to this hotel and i'm sure I will return again for my next trip to Paris! It is in an amazing location, right in the heart of the Marais and close to the river, perfect for exploring Paris from. The hotel is charming and beautiful, rooms are pretty with wonderful fabric walls, furnishings, comfy beds and white clean bathrooms. The rooms are fairly small however a good size for Paris. We had a room at the front of the hotel with a balcony. The balcony was a nice addition as we could sit outside and watch Paris life go by below. However it was noisy at night time, especially compared to the room we had last year at the back of the hotel overlooking the courtyard. Bring some ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. The breakfast is lovely and very large - one to share between 2 of us was ample! The staff are so friendly and helpful! This place is a real gem and a joy to stay in!

Reviews.Title: “There is no better location”
Reviews.Author: Adriabreu
Reviews.Content: The best location you'll find in Paris in the heart of Le Marais, a few minutes from Ile de la Cité and Ile de St Luis and the subway station. In the very street of the hotel you'll find bistros, stores, boulangeries, and lots of other kinds of stores. Staff is incredibly kind and helpful. Rooms are small, but clean and cozy. Bathrooms are also small, but have all you need for a comfy and warm shower. If you like stayng in a good location, sleeping well, being well treated, if you don't care for luxury, big lobbies, and useless amenities and if you prefer "living" Paris in the streets instead of inside a hotel room, you will love Caron de Bausmarchais.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: SteveFromBoulder
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! The location is ideal, the staff incredibly helpful, and the style of the hotel & rooms is very charming. Small rooms (not unexpected), but amazing use of space. Simply wonderful in every way!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: MmeFalk
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in a room facing the street. It wasn't huge but big enough since you don't spend that much time in your room when in Paris for a couple of days. The location is really perfect; central, but not too noisy and busy. Nice shopping in the same street in the small boutiques of the Marais, easy to find a restaurant and still near all the sights you want to see during a short visit. Very friendly and personal staff at front desk and at breakfast. Decent breakfast for being French incl. eggs, yoghurt and cheese.

Reviews.Title: “perfect jewel”
Reviews.Author: oceanrose126
Reviews.Content: Since 2003 we have stayed at Hotel Caron de Beaumarchais perhaps a dozen times or more. Without question, Hotel Caron de Beaumarchais is our ideal hotel in Paris. Located in the lively Marais arrondissement and only a very quick walk from the Hotel de Ville metro stop, which is the premiere metro line and is highly convenient, we find the hotel location ideal. Coming back to the hotel in the evening from dining, one is presented with the stunning Hotel de Ville, which is lit beautifully at night as well as the Isle de Saint-Louis and the iconic Notre Dame Cathedral. The BHV department store is only moments away where one can pick up anything that might have been forgotten from home. Wonderful and interesting shopping abounds in the Marais and the surrounding area. The hotel is a true gem. M. Bigeard, the owner, has meticulously and lovingly restored this structure. As an interior designer, I can attest that he uses some of the finest French textiles available. His attention to detail is meticulous. Each time we return, it is apparent that he has updated or enhanced the hotel and the rooms in some manner. The rooms are small, but every square inch has been used wisely so that we have never felt cramped. There is ample storage and hanging space in both the bedroom and bathroom- even down to the smallest detail of providing a retractable clothes line over the deeply luxurious bathtub. The beds and pillows are quite comfortable and I was amazed to see that the blankets are actually fine mohair. All of the staff at the hotel have been hand selected and there are still people at the hotel that are working since the first time that we came in 2003. Whatever request we might have had, the staff has been more than willing to help us- From making and confirming dinner reservations before and during our stay to inviting my husband to meet with a colleague in the breakfast dining area to helping us to find one of the gorgeous, fine mohair blankets that are on each bed to making suggestions for my care when I became ill on our first stay at the hotel. The breakfast at this delightful boutique hotel is wonderful. Fine tea or coffee, delicious croissants and baguettes, fruit, cheese, yogurt. Wonderful! One can either enjoy breakfast in the privacy of the room or eat in the gorgeous breakfast room downstairs. Fresh flowers are in every room and a fabulous, large bouquet is in the breakfast room along with an ever changing botanic display by the elevators. We enjoy staying on the front side of the hotel so that we can watch Parisian life outside of our French doors. I could not possibly give this charming boutique hotel a higher recommendation and can well see that M. Bigeard has used only the finest through the hotel. Paris for us would simply not be as wonderful without staying at Hotel Caron de Beaumarchais.

Reviews.Title: “I have stayed at this hotel both times I...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel both times I visited Paris, and if I get the opportunity to return, I would stay there again. Though the rooms are petit, the staff is friendly and very helpful. They treated my husband and myself very respectfully, in spite of our youthful appearance. The decor is charming throughout, the breakfast is decadent, and there is free wireless internet. The hotel is situated right off the Rue de Rivoli, so it is in walking distance from the Louvre, as well as the french department store, BHV. I recommend this hotel for romantics and 17th century history lovers because of the ambiance that evokes the romance of the past.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the City”
Reviews.Author: paulaskinner62
Reviews.Content: We emailed this hotel the day before we travelled to Paris with a tentative enquiry. When we arrived they remembered us and we had a fantastic welcome despite the fact that there were only vacancies for one night instead of the two we wanted. They offered to show us the room and allow us to decide if we would like it for one night and they would find us similar accommodation in the area for the next night, or we could chose to go somewhere else for our entire stay and they would ring round for us. Well I have never been made to feel so welcome and we stayed the first night and were just disappointed that we could not stay for 2. We will never have to search for a hotel in Paris as we have now found this jewel in a superb location. Walking distance to the Louvre, Notre Dame and several metro stations. Quaint hotel with traditional french decor. Clean and spacious for Paris standards and air conditioning which was a must with temperatures into the 30's. Owner was multilingual and could not do enough.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect birthday gift”
Reviews.Author: Sari-Saurus
Reviews.Content: Hugs to the owners of this wonderful hotel. You made my mothers birthday one-of - a-kind. It was everything and more than I exepted! Everyone in the hotel was adorable, kind and real - no faking in the smile! :-)) Room 21 was perfect!! small 2 person balcony - so Paris! Clean - really nice decor, sweets in a small jar - fantastic bathroom - and the breakfast - Worth every euro! Do not miss that - you can last until dinner with that great breaky! and all you have to do is sit in peace while waited on. Love the place - will go again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shuuz
Reviews.Content: The hotel Caron de Beaumarchais is a charming boutique hotel located in the Marais section of Paris. (the Soho of Paris). The hotel is tastefully decorated in antique furnishings with great attention to detail such as fresh flowers, beautiful wallpaper, window treatments, art, etc. The hotel features a small lobby, breakfast room (cave), tiny elevator and rooms either facing the street or courtyard. There actually is no court yard. The rooms in the back face an airshaft with plants and flowers along the ground level. We had booked the least expensive room facing the courtyard. However, it was so small and dark that we instantly upgraded to a room facing the street with a small balcony. It was well worth the extra expense for a slighter larger room with more sunlight and a balcony with a small table and chairs overlooking the roof tops of Paris. The staff were helpful and friendly and instantly provided extra pillows and even a shower curtain. (the bathroom had a tub and a hand held shower which attached to the wall but no shower curtain) I ordered coffee sent to my room each morning (for just a few dollars) which arrived in under five minutes of placing the order. The room included a comfortable bed, soft pillows, a mini bar, terry cloth bathrobes, make-up mirror, TV (with CNN) and a tiny desk. Everything in the hotel is miniature! The hotel Caron de Beaumarchais is big on charm and small on space.We loved the hotel and will definately return. While in Paris we enjoyed a fabulous dinner at Chez Janou near the home of Victor Hugo.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, well located friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SouthCoastHarold
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the advice of a friend who had stayed previously so were not really taking any risks! A great value, small hotel very well located near Notre Dame Cathedral in the Marais district. Very friendly staff, compact but clean and well equipped rooms and with a continental breakfast that quickly became keenly anticipated each morning. On arrival we were warmly greeted by the english speaking manager (having tried our GCSE level french on him!) and shown to our room which was fairly compact but had everything required for a long weekend with a hectic schedule of seeing as much of Paris as possible, when spending a fortune of a very posh hotel would have been pointless for the amount of time spent in the room. We chose to have the hotel breakfast each morning which was an excellent choice and kept us going until our evening meal each day with just a small lunch required. The reception staff were only too happy to point us in the direction of bars and places to eat in the evening and we wound up each evening at a very friendly, very French local bar (and a little effort with the language definately went a long way!). Overall, if we were to return to Paris we would stay here again without hesitation and use the money we saved from a more showy hotel to sample some serious French cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “Captures True Paris”
Reviews.Author: clairebear2222
Reviews.Content: Hotel Caron de Beaumarchais was such a find!! Our Parisian friends suggested we stay here and we are so happy we did! Each day we awoke to a beautiful room with wood beams and lovely French furniture. We could open our windows to a beautiful little balcony and enjoy feel of Paris. Room size was a bit small but no smaller than most in Paris. The concierge was quite welcoming but I think was happy to see us depart because we asked for hot water for tea each night when we came home around 7 or 8pm, we felt like we really put them out by asking for this but they put up with our outlandish demands! (lol) They were truly kind to us and gave us directions and recommendations at every turn. This hotel is extremely convenient to walk anywhere!! To Notre Dame and a short bus ride to the Louvre or Muse'e D'Orsay or even to the Eiffel Tour, the baus station is right around the corner from the hotel. I highly recommend taking the bus like a regular Parisian, who by the way, were incredibly helpful to these two Americans who could not speak proper French. The trick here is to "attempt" to speak some French; once they know you're trying, they're much more apt to help you. About the bus, take the bus rather than the metro, you'll experience Paris as it should be experienced, like a local! On the whole, Beaumarchais was a wonderful place to stay, cozy, convenient and courteous(for the most part!) Rooms on the small size, no American television but I didn't come to Paris to watch TV I came to see Paris and that I did from this wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Charming & Lovely”
Reviews.Author: CantThinkOfAnything4
Reviews.Content: Caron de Beaumarchais is the epitome of an old Parisian hotel--at least, what I imagine one to be. Combined with the very reasonable rates (they were about $225 a night back in November 2009 when the exchange rate was far more unfavorable for American travelers) I thought it was a bargain for centrally located hotels. The rooms and furnishings (the bureau, light fixtures and carpets) are of a vintage that harkens to another time period in Paris, yet are not so frayed as to be downtrodden. The windows lookout onto a cute streetscape. The breakfasts that they provide are quite excellent--warm, buttery and flaky croissants, assortments of jams, fresh squeezed OJ, yogurt that doesnt come from a factory (they come in these cute little porcelain jars which appear to be made by local dairy farmers). The hotel itself is in the Marais--though there aren't really any sights in the area (save for the Hotel d'Ville and the Place des Vosges), it is a short walk to the Metro, which will take you anywhere in town. Notre Dame and the Ile de Paris are both very near and definitely walkable. And, of course, the Seine is right near by as well. There are several small restaurants and cafes in the vicinity of the hotel, but none of the top rated restaurants that we wanted to try. If you are considering hotels located in one of the outer arrondissements or even near the airport (they seemed to have the best deals), dont!! Being centrally located was a tremendous advantage in that it allowed us to have short commutes back to the hotel at the end of a long day. The internet service is just reliable enough to check email and lookup information on sights, but not fast enough to stream any multimedia during downtime. Also the front desk staff are all very knowledgeable and friendly. We were able to get great info from them regarding the Marche aux Puces. The only downside are the very small rooms. However, its Paris, everything is expensive and you can't expect to get luxurious accommodations for what they charge. Overall, I thought it was a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: M1lla
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay at this charming hotel for four nights in April. The location of the hotel is very good in the middle of Marais. The hotel itself is amazingly cute and the staff was very nice to us. The gentleman who met us at check in was very nice suggesting some good walks around the area and some good trips around the must-sees in Paris. Our room facing the street had a small balcony which we unfortunately could not use since the weather was not the best. But if possible, a breakfast at the balcony must for sure be a nice way to start the day. The room was very cute with lots of charming details and although the interior was neither modern nor up to date it fitted the old property perfect and altogether the atmosphere was fantastic. The only draw back was that for us to tall Scandinavians the bed was to small with our feet hangning out and the bathroom required some acrobatic moves. The room in all was very small, but on the other hand you don't spend too much time in the room when you have all of Marais just out the door. There was free wifi which worked pretty good. I loved the area, with lots of nice bistro and bars as well as many small and interesting little shops. There was of course lots of tourists but still the whole area felt less touristy than for example the area around seventh or eight arrondisement. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone. The hotel, room and service was excellent and the interior absolutely marvellous. The area was beautiful and we spent most of our vacation just browsing through the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in trendy Area”
Reviews.Author: nurmos
Reviews.Content: After flying to London to visit some friends, my "London Crew" and I decided to make the short trip to Paris. We decided to be spontaneous so even after we landed at Charles De Gaulle we had no idea where we were staying. Fortunately, a friend of a friend decided that we should take a taxi from the airport to an area called hotel de ville (50 euros BTW) (FYI Hotel De Ville is also an subway/underground stop). We meet him there and we were figuring out where we wanted to stay. We weren't looking for anything too pricey but we wanted a safe trendy neighborhood and one that is in proximity to public transport. He immediately chose this hotel. Absolutely love it. Its very French, and true to it's form the rooms are quite small. I had a room on the 2nd floor with a balcony. It was a nice touch but with February weather, the balcony felt like quite a waste. Although if you are a smoker it's probably convenient to use your balcony as the entire premises is non-smoking. The amenities were lacking which at first didn't really bother me because I wasn't planning on spending much time in the hotel but I found it rather inconvenient when I needed to use the internet they didn't have those facilities present. The friendly receptionist directed me to a place down the street. Points reduced for that. The major selling point for this already chic hotel, is the area. There are lots of bars, cafe's and shops that are walking distance and being that it is off a major street (Rue de Rivoli) it is pretty easy to get to in the event you're directionally challenged even after a long day of sight seeing, shopping and hopefully club hopping. Given my spontaneous experience, I may have missed this gem if I had actually planned ahead but I would probably stay here next time I come to Paris. Would I recommend this place for a couple? Definitely yes. Group of friends? Yes, but for a small intimate group because the hotel seems to have very little vacancy even for the off season. If you are in a large group the likelihood is that you'd be separated due to a lack of rooms. For a Family with kids? Not so sure. Its lack of amenities will likely be felt.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Very French”
Reviews.Author: jyc510
Reviews.Content: Paris was the city I visited on my first European excursion. After my apartment rental fell through at the last minute, I booked my week long stay at Caron de Beaumarchais. I'm glad I did. Very friendly service, quaint and charming room and amazing location. The bathroom was a little stinky (I was tempted to get some Clorox), but frankly, I tried not to stay too much in the room. I really enjoyed the breakfast - simple but very good. Location can't be beat and as a solo female traveler, I felt very safe. I have really fond memories of my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: hotheads1
Reviews.Content: We totally enjoyed our stay. The staff was excellent, location perfect and the room charming. It could not have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I imagined it would be and more”
Reviews.Author: missrogue
Reviews.Content: About 3 years ago while wandering around Le Marais, I passed by Caron de Beaumarchais and fell in love with it's charm. I took a photo that I posted on Flickr and tagged so I could remember the name of this hotel when I returned. Unfortunately, 10 months later when I returned, there was no vacancy. :( This year, after being away from Paris for too long, I had the chance to return and sent an email to the hotel to see about availability. Sure enough it was! Of course, all of the anticipation really raised my expectations. But Caron de Beaumarchais didn't disappoint. It was as charming on the inside as the outside. The hotel gave me the rooftop floor with the balcony - something I couldn't really use as it was rainy in Paris while I was there, but adored nonetheless. The room, as are all Paris rooms, was tiny, but charming. The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. The location couldn't be beat. The room was clean. The view was amazing. And I got a kick out of watching others stop and stare at the beautiful front of the hotel when I was waiting in the lobby area. The price was incredible for such a great location. I'd recommend this hotel highly. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Honey Moon”
Reviews.Author: FouineLapin
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in this hotel during our honey moon last July and it was exactly what we expected - Great location, charming hotel. The Roget Gallet soaps was a nice touch. International papers with breakfast big enough for two people. Helpful staff (speak many languages fluently). Free High speed Internet, which was perfect to plan our days and nights. Rooms are small as you would expect in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Gruntor
Reviews.Content: The Marai is really good. Train stations are nearby and it is a short walk to notre dame. Lots of great eateries nearby and good shopping. The hotel is pretty small, but they have definitely made the most of what they have. It is really well decorated - we loved it. Our room was very small, with no view, only an internal window to a void. Still, this was no problem. We found out about this through a hip hotels book and I think the price for here is very good for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable place in a central location”
Reviews.Author: travellerim
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about the place is the central location, but as it's right on top of the noisy rue de Rivoli even that isn't so great. Our room was small and noisy and not very clean. Breakfast is a disgrace- grossly overpriced and really basic (and we are neither big or fussy eaters). Breakfast is served at the basement and while eating you can enjoy looking at the cleaner dealing with the dirty laundry in the next room. With the metro being so efficient, I think it's pointless to go for the central tourist traps. (and no, it's not full of "Parisian charm" , whatever that means).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for what it is”
Reviews.Author: obsessivehotelcritic
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights with my two small daughters. This hotel is excellent for what it is- a quaint, clean, charming parisian three star in an outstanding location. The rooms are attractive but well organised (mini bar under sink in the bathroom!) and clean. We had a balcony (second floor streetfront room) which was a treat. The air conditioning is excellent, the toiletries, towels and bathrobes are superb, the staff are very friendly and helpful. And the location is incredible, in Marais, a few minutes walk to the Seine, Ile St. Louis, Notre Dame, etc... For a leisure visit to Paris in this price range, I cant imagine anything much better. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great location in the marais”
Reviews.Author: LiffordClare
Reviews.Content: beautiful boutique hotel, great location and service only drawback is the cheaper rooms ( courtyard view) are small, and a bit dark. it is worth the extra 10 euros for the front facing windows. whiach are larger and brighter. would go back in an instant

Reviews.Title: “So French, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bigtsur
Reviews.Content: Typical, quaint French Hotel in the hip Marais area. Close to the Hôtel de Ville and Pompidou Center (Metro about 6 blocks). We stayed in a lovely room (#10) on the second floor with a faboulous view and large windows that opened up to the street. The breakfast was delightful: great croissants, bread, jam, butter, fresh OJ, coffee and hard boiled egg served in a tiny kitchenette (or in your room). Yes, the rooms were small, but decorated lovingly. The service was fabulous, English speaking and with an attendant always at the front desk (entrance) which was more like a small living room. We would return and recommend this hotel. For the price we felt this was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Not so perfect...”
Reviews.Author: Ambie1957
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caron de Beaumarchais at Christmastime this year. We has stayed there about 6 years prior, and had lovely memories. Not this time. Our room was tiny (I know, it's a Parisian hotel) dark, overlooked the noisy Rue de Rivoli, had a bathroom the size of a closet, with almost no actual closet space in the room. When we asked about changing rooms, the gentleman at the desk told us ALL the rooms were this small. (Maybe we were younger then, and more easily enchanted...)
